// learn-to-code/src/pages/Setup/Setup.js import React from 'react'; import DarkModeToggle from '../../../components/DarkModeToggle/DarkModeToggle'; import TableOfContents from '../../../components/TableOfContents/TableOfContents'; import './Setup.css'; function Setup() { const sections = [ { id: 'intro', title: 'Introduction' }, { id: 'intro-1', title: '1.1 Overview', subsection: true }, { id: 'install-python', title: 'Install Python' }, { id: 'install-pip', title: 'Install pip' }, { id: 'install-vscode', title: 'Install Visual Studio Code' }, { id: 'install-extensions', title: 'Install Extensions' }, { id: 'summary', title: 'Summary' }, ] return (

Let's get started

Introduction

Overview

Before we start writing Python code, we need to set up our development environment. This includes installing Python, a code editor, and some extensions.

Install Python

Python is a programming language that is used to write code. You can download the latest version of Python from the official website.

Install pip

pip is a package manager for Python that allows you to install third-party libraries. You can install pip by running a command in the terminal.

Install Visual Studio Code

Visual Studio Code is a code editor that is popular among Python developers. You can download Visual Studio Code from the official website.

Install Extensions

There are some extensions that can make your Python development experience better. You can install these extensions from the Visual Studio Code marketplace.

Summary

In this section, we learned how to set up our development environment for Python. We installed Python, pip, Visual Studio Code, and some extensions.

); } export default Setup;
